turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: How do you like them jokers? Taking me for a pigeon.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Gimme the names, I'll write 'em down in me little book.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Didn't you recognize him, dopey. That's Old Man Doyle.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Doyle.  Joey Doyle's... .?  ... .You're his... .

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I was gonna feed 'em, Terry.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: 's all right, kid. I took care of 'em myself this morning.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Boy, you must've been up early.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, I was awake anyway so I figured  They got it made. Eat all they want fly around like crazy sleep side by side and raise gobs of squabs.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I wonder how long she's goin' to hang around, huh, Terry?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Be sure they got enough water.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: She's a he. His name is Swifty.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: My lead bird. He's always on that top perch.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Better.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Yeah, once they're mated they stay together all their lives until one of 'em dies.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hey, Terry, guess who's here... that joker from the Commission... .

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Looking for me?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: He's got his nerve, gum-shoeing around here after what you told him.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Jimmy, suppose I knew something, say a mug somebody put on somebody... .  You think I should turn him in?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: A cheese-eater!  You're kidding!

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Yeah, I'm kidding, I'm kidding. You don't think I should turn him in... .

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You was a Golden Warrior.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Yeah us Golden Warriors.  You're a good kid, Jimmy, a good tough kid. We stick together, huh, kid?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You was our first Supreme Commander, Terry. Keep out of sight and I'll tell him you're out.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: But I ain't out. I'm in. I'm in. Who's lying to who?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Is Johnny in?

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Give me a double.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Take it easy now, Terry.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Keep the advice. Give me the whiskey.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: What's wrong with your shoulder?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Hit me again.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Listen, kid, why don't you go home before Johnny... .

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: No advice. Just whiskey.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Easy. Easy, boy.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: You ought to go home and take care of that

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: First things first.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Terry?  What do you want?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Hey look-

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah? Must be Danny-boy. I lost him in the last race.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: He followed my birds into their coop. Here, you want him?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Well I got to watch myself these days. Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I'll bring him up to your loft.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I'll see you on the roof.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey, Skins  --get away with that sheet metal all right?

turns.speaker: SKINS
turns.text: Easy, that new checker faked the receipt. Here it is, boss.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Stow the receipt. I'll take the cash.

turns.speaker: SKINS
turns.text: Forty-five bills.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey, Terry, front and center.

turns.speaker: SKINS
turns.text: I I musta counted wrong, boss, I

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Gimme.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: H'ya, slugger, how they hangin'?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: So-so, Johnny.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Don't hit me, now, don't hit me!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Count this.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Aw, you know I don't like to count, Johnny.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: It's good for you. Develops your mind.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Shut up. I like the kid.  Remember the night he took Farella at St. Nick's, Charley. We won a bundle. Real tough. A big try.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Not a dent.  Perfect

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: My favorite little cousin.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Thirty-six sev aah I lost the count.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: OK skip it, Einstein. How come you never got no education like the rest of us?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I know, Johnny, I know... .

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Takin' over this local, you know it took a little doin'. Some pretty tough fellas were in the way. They left me this  to remember them by.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Well, no, Johnny, I just thought I should've been told if

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You come from Green Point? Go back to Green Point. You don't work here no more.  Here, kid, here's half a bill. Go get your load on.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Naw, thanks, Johnny, I don't want it, I

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Go on a little present from your Uncle Johnny.  And Mac, tomorra mornin' when you shape the men put Terry in the loft. Number one. Every day.  Nice easy work. Check in and goof off on the coffee bags. O.K.?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Thanks, Johnny... .

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I I was just on my way up, Johnny.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: By way of Chicago?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: It must have been once too often. I think your brains come apart. What you got up there, Chinese bells?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Aw, Johnny... .

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I thought you were gonna keep an eye on that church meeting.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Nothing happened, Johnny.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Nothing happened, he says. Some operator you got yourself there, Charley. One more like him and we'll all be wearing striped pajamas.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: It was a big nothing! The Father did all the talking.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Oh, he did. Half an hour later a certain Timothy J. Nolan went into secret session with the Commission and he did all the talking.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: You mean Kayo Nolan, the old timer? He doesn't know much.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He don't, huh?  Well, he knows thirty-nine pages worth of our operation.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: How'd you get that.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I got it. Hot off the press.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Guts! A crummy pigeon who's looking to get his neck wrung!  You should have  You should have known better than to trust this punched out brother of yours. He was all right hanging around for laughs. But this is business. I don't like goofoffs messing in our business.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Now just a minute, I

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You want to know the trouble with you? You think it makes you a big man if you can give the answers.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Listen, Johnny

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Go on beat it. Don't push your luck.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: You want to know somethin'?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I said beat it! At the right time I'll catch up with you. Be thinkin' about it.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: You want to know something? Take the heater away and you're nothin' take the good goods away, and the kickback and the shakedown cabbage away and the pistoleros  away and you're a great big hunk of nothing  Your guts is all in your wallet and your trigger finger!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Go on talkin'. You're talkin' yourself right into the river. Go on, go on... .

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I'm glad what I done today, see? You give it to Joey, you give it to Nolan, you give it to Charley who was one of your own. You thought you was God Almighty instead of a cheap connivinggood-for-nothing bum! So I'm glad what I done you hear me? glad what I done!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You ratted on us, Terry.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: From where you stand, maybe. But I'm standing over here now. I was rattin' on myself all them years and didn't know it, helpin' punks like you against people like Pop and Nolan an'... .

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Come on. I want you. You're mine. You're mine! Come on!

turns.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
turns.text: You got some nerve.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
turns.text: You know what I mean. Leave her alone.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I was only talkin' to her.

turns.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
turns.text: She's off limits for bums like you. Leave her alone.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: I can look at her, can't I? It's a free country.

turns.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
turns.text: Not that free.

turns.speaker: MUTT
turns.text: Tippi-tippi-tim, tippi-tim, Tippi-tippi-tan, tippi-tan...  Gotta dime for a crippled-up docker?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Go on, beat it!

turns.speaker: MUTT
turns.text: A dime, Terry, a dime for a cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Don't give me that coffee, you rummy. Now blow!

turns.speaker: MUTT
turns.text: Thanks for nothing, you bum.

turns.speaker: MUTT
turns.text: A dime. One thin dime for a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Coffee, that's a laugh. His belly is used to nothing but rotgut whiskey.

turns.speaker: MUTT
turns.text: One little dime you don't need.  I know you you're Edie Doyle. Your Brother's a saint  only one ever tried to get me my compensation.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah Here's half a buck, go have yourself a ball.

turns.speaker: MUTT
turns.text: I can't believe it a small fortune.   You can't buy me you're still a bum!  'Bye, Edie. Lord have mercy on Joey.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Look who says bum!

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: A banana boat. It would be bananas.  One of these days me ship's comin' in from Ireland,  God love 'er, loaded to the gunnels with sweet Irish whiskey!

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Nolan, me lad, ye're dreamin' again.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: You see, Kayo, the good Lord watches over us after all.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: When we knock off let's have a bit of a party. We'll drink to God and Ireland, its whiskey and its women, to Joey and Edie  and death to tyrants everywhere... .!

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: You think one bottle's enough for all them toasts?

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Patrick, me lad, I'm ahead of you.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: I was afraid one bottle might get lonely by itself.  Now you see the advantage of a little man in a big coat.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Definitely! Nolan, my boy, you're a walkin' distillery.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: I wonder how many Hail Marys the Father'll make me say at confession.  It'll be worth it! The pallet is loaded now. Terry turns and approaches Nolan.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: The brother of Charley the Gent. They'll help us get to the bottom of the river.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Keep Charley out of this.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: You don't think he'd be helpful?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Go ask him, why don't you ? Ask him yourself.

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: Maybe I will one of these days.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: One of these days.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Listen Nolan

turns.speaker: NOLAN
turns.text: What are you down here for to see we don't make off with any of Mister Friendly's precious cargo?

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Nolan... .

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Leave her alone, you fiend!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Fiend is it!  You will not be so fortunate.  Your existence will cease within moments.  No one wishes to see a man dance...  And you, my dear, will entertain for centuries to come.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: If I could get my hands on you...

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: ..Oh, You could do nothing!  I can save you much pain.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Leave her alone, I tell you!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I do not joke in my proposal.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: We sure picked the wrong night to find a cemetery.  Let's turn back.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No.  It's on a night like this when the best ideas come to mind.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: But does it have to be in a cemetery?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You wouldn't understand.  Seeing a cemetery on a night like this can stir in the mind the best ideas for a good horror story.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: But there're so many wonderful things to write about, Bob.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Sure there are--and I've tried them all.  Plays, love stories, westerns, dog stories.  Huh, now there was a good one, that dog story all about--

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: But horror stories!  Why all the time horror stories?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Shirley, I wrote for years without selling a single word.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Your puritan upbringing holds you back from my monsters, but it certainly doesn't hurt your art of kissing.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: That's life.  My kisses are alive.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Who's to say my monsters aren't alive?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: All of my books are based on fact, or legend.  Thats perhaps why they're more interesting and sell in the top spots.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Well, fact or not, I don't see how we're going to find an ancient cemetery in these mountains tonight.  I can't see a thing!  Let's turn back.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: There's an old cemetery on this road. I've been there before.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I'm getting the jitters! Let's turn back!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well we certainly can't stay here. C'mon.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: In there.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: It frightens me.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Silly, there's nothing in there to be afraid of.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Then..then what's that music?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That's what I want to find out. We have to get help.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: What help can we possibly find in the cemetery at this time of night?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Something's making that music.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I'm not sure I care to find out what it is.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: All right.  Don't worry, I'll be right beside you.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: What help will that do if something in there isn't dead?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Not dead?  In a cemetery?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I can't imagine anything dead playing that music.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, it's probably just the caretaker, and that's exactly who we want to find.  They'll have a telephone.  C'mon.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Could it be some kind of college initiation?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's an initiation all right, but not of a college as you and I know them.  Nothing alive looks like that!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Can't we get out of here?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm not sure...

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm not sure, myself. It's just a feeling I've had since the crash...Like I feel a cold chill all over.. ..Now this!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Look!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Be careful!--They'll see you.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I'm so frightened.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You've got a right to be. We're trapped by a bunch of fiends.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Those creatures..!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Don't let them hear you.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: What can we do?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know.  I just don't know. But don't give up. We're not finished yet.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Easy Shirley, Easy!  Panic won't do us any good!  Let me think. We've got to stall for time.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I'm afraid I'll faint.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Whatever you do, don't do that.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: The ropes are coming loose.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Be careful!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I am--It's our only chance.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Nothing is worth your life.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: My guess is if we don't take the chance pretty soon, we're not going to have much life left anyway.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I'm frightened.  I'm so frightened.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Hold on just a little longer, Shirley.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Be careful, oh please be careful.  We'll never get out of here alive, I know it.  I just feel it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Yes I feel it in my bones.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You're talking nonsense.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Oh, no I'm not.  These heathens probably have an open grave for us.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: They wouldn't dare put us in the same grave-- or would they?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I should hope not.  I hate you!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That sudden?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Yes, that sudden.  If it weren't for you we wouldn't be hunting for an old cemetery on a night like this.  It's all your fault.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: ...And I thought you loved me.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I've got the ropes loose now. I've got my hands free.  Be careful--Don't change your expression too much.  They must not catch on.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: What can we do against them?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know, yet.  We'll just have to watch our chance. When it comes I'll know what to do--I hope I'll know what to do.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I still don't know what ever made me go steady with a crackpot writer like you.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: All right.  Put it on heavy.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: My old boyfriend Tommy would never have gotten me in a mess like this. At least he's got brains.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Him! I'll bet he sleeps with all the lights on.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Maybe so.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I love you Bob. I really do. Forgive me?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: There's nothing to forgive. It was all a dream.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: You love me then?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Of course I do.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: But they are not yet one of us.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: A situation easily remedied.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: Tie them that they may watch.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: ...And what is this?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: A symbol, Master.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: What kind of symbol?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: She loved the bull ring and the matador.  She danced to their destruction. Now she dances to her own destruction.  Her dance is of skulls.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: She came to us on the Day of the Dead.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: El Dia De Los Muertos...A celebration in her country.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Her dance has pleased me.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: She was?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: As I said, a worshipper of snakes, and of smoke, and flames.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Oh, yes, a religion of sorts.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: It would seem so, Master.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: She pleases me.  Permit her to live in the World of the Snakes.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Now, I will talk...to The Wolf Man...and The Mummy.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: As you wish, Master

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Yes, yes yes I know all that.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: At the first sight of the morning sun's rays, we must be gone.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I suppose most of the others will have to wait for their judgement until after the next full moon.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: It would seem so, Master

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ahh, but I declare there is still time for something.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: She is to be mine! It is so spoken!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: The Princess of Darkness would have you for her own to join us through extreme pain.  Yet I am inclined for one as lovely as you, to be more lenient. I have but to touch you with my finger, and it would mean the end of you, all over, quickly and painlessly...

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ahh, she will be yours.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: When!?

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: At your discretion...But first, I desire more entertainment.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: The moon is almost gone!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ahh, there is yet time.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: At the first sight of the morning's rays' light...

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I know the laws of the night. I state there is still time for yet another.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: I would have time for my own pleasures!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Your own pleasure comes only after mine, when I desire it. I am the Sole Ruler of the Dark World. There is no one to challenge my authority here. My word is the law--all powerful. No one is to challenge that authority, no one!. Is that understood? It is my command.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: I understand, Master

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Then see that it does not happen again, in the penalty of Everlasting Despair.  Now are there others?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: There are others.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Well then let us proceed.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: The moon sinks lower into the hills!  We must hurry to the finish.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I will decide the conclusion.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: You had the mummy cancel all the others scheduled for this session.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Then cancel my order.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: The moon is almost gone!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: There is yet time.  Don't you want your own pleasure?

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: Oh, if there is only time!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Hahh, there is always time... All in good time...there is always time. You shall have your pleasure. THAT... I decree

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: All others were but infinitessimal bits of fluff, compared to her This one would have died for feathers, furs, and fluff...and so she did!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: The time...is short.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: For what!?!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Your pleasures of course!

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: You mean...!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: You may take her now.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: Is there time?

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: You better hope there is.

turns.speaker: PRINCESS OF DARKNESS
turns.text: Thank you, Master!  Thank you.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Now hurry, hurry.  I will watch!  Your desires may be my pleasure also...Our fitting climax to an evening's enter- tainment.  You must...hurry now.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: They are live ones?

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Yes, Master.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Live ones where only the dead should be?

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Yes, Master, and we caught them, him and me.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Have we in some way made you angry, Master?

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: You know better than that.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: We don't know of anything, Master...

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Then why do you shake so?

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: It's not often an Emperor like you calls on creatures like us.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Well rest easy, I'm not angry with either of you.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Aaaahhhh.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Then it is some service you desire of us.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: You are the keepers of the Damned.  You two know them all. And I am tired of this usual type of entertainment. I want...a decided change.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: There are one or two which should complement the night's entertainment, Master

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ahh, good.  Then I will see them.  Dismiss the rest.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Yes, sir, Master.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ahh, the curiousity of youth... on the road to ruin!  May it ever be so adventurous!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I'm so frightened.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I have promised both The Wolf Man and The Mummy a reward. It could be that you are that reward.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: You need not worry...Not just now, anyway.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: No. No! No!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I repulse you? Very well. It seems you have chosen your own fate. Live with it! I should say die with it!

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: I don't like snakes.  I remember the one Cleopatra used.  Cute little rascal until it flicked out that red tongue, and those two sharp fangs.  You'd never think such a little thing packed such a big wallop.

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aaaaahhnnnhaaaaaannnhhh?

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Hurt her?  Hell, it killed her!

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aaaahhhhnnnahhhnnnggnnn.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: We had lots of snakes in my ancient Egypt...slimy, slinky things.

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aahhhhnnnaaahahnn. AaaaaahhhhoooWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: When I was alive, they were the things nightmares were made of.

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aaarrrgggaahh.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: He wants us.

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aaahhnnnahnnnn.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: What do you suppose for?

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aaaaannnnnuuunnnuhhhhh?

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Did you do something to get us into trouble again?

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aannnnaahhnn.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Did you howl off-key at the moon again?

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Aannnnaahhnn.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: I can't remember doing anything wrong either.

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: I could make her another Cleopatra...

turns.speaker: THE WOLF MAN
turns.text: Ahh hahahhnnn hahnnn!

turns.speaker: THE MUMMY
turns.text: Without the snake, of course.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That's funny, Adele.  How many more times you gonna gimme that one?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Till it's not funny any more.  What do you want, Jack?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You know that Super Bowl party?  They changed the date.  It's on <u>tonight</u>, eight-thirty.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Didn't you tell me one-time calls aren't monitored?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I said not as a rule.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: So why don't you come right out and tell me what you're talking about?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Listen to Miss Smarty Mouth.  Out there in the free world.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: What's free about it?  I'm looking for work.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What happened to Mandrake the Magician?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Emil the Amazing.  The bastard fired me and hired another girl, a redhead. I'm working on a new business card, pass out to the cafes.  How's this sound--

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Listen, Adele, the reason I called, that party is today instead of Sunday. About eight-thirty, like only a few hours from now.  So you'll have to get hold of Buddy, whatever he might be doing...

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: And the one driving the other car?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What're you talking about?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Well, seeing as you have so much luck with cars, Buddy thought it might be better to bring two.  He got this guy he says you know from Lompoc, Glenn something.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Glenn Michaels.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Yeah, that's him.  Buddy says Glenn thinks you guys are real cool.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: He did, huh.  Well, tell Buddy I see Glenn wearing his sunglasses I'll step on 'em.  I might not even take 'em off first.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Oh, is this Adele?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Uh-- sorry.  Wrong number.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: I want to speak with you, please.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Lie face down on the floor.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: You do the sawing of the box in half trick with you inside?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Tell me, how do you do that?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You were both in the trunk? Together?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: From Glades to the turnpike.  Then I left with Glenn.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The FBI didn't tell you I was with them?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: They didn't tell me anything, they asked questions.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But you know what I'm talking about, don't you?  About Glenn, don't you, and the second car?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I know a Glenn.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I'm getting ready to go out.  You can come in if you want, sit down for a minute.  Would you like a Diet Coke?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, thanks.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: He didn't hurt you or anything, did he?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You mean, did he try to jump me?  No, but he was kind of talkative.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: He gets that way when he's nervous sometimes.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You didn't visit him in prison.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: He didn't want me to.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I don't know.  He was different after he was sentenced, looking at thirty years.  Said it depressed him every time the younger cons called him an old timer.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But you spoke to him on the phone.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: He'd call every once in a while.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He called the day he escaped.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: He did?  I don't remember.  Did he say about me?  In the trunk?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He said he wished the two of you could start over, live a normal life.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Huh.  Problem is, Jack's idea of a normal life is robbing banks.  It's all he's ever done.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Did you know that when you married him?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: He said he was a card player.  I could live with that.  I never knew he robbed banks till he got busted with that car that caught fire -- if you can imagine something like that happening, comes out of the bank and the car's on fire. I did go see him in jail to tell him I was filing for divorce.  He said, "Okay."  Jack's so easy going.  He was fun, but never what you'd call a real husband.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I'll say one thing for Jack, he was never ugly or mean, or drank too much. He was very considerate, lights on or off, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Really.  Hm.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Adele, sooner or later, he's gonna get caught.  I'd like to get him before he does something else, makes it worse on himself.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Buddy'll take care of him.  Keep him out've trouble.  He's Jack's conscience. Always has been.  He tell you how they met?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Jack came out of a bank he just robbed in Pasadena, couldn't get his stolen car to start.  Battery was dead.  He looks over, sees Buddy sitting in a burgundy Bonneville, goes up, offers him a thousand dollars for a jump. Turns out, Buddy was casing the same bank and saw the whole thing.  Buddy says, I'll take the thousand, but we're leaving in my car, not that piece of shit you come in.  They musta robbed fifty banks together.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Till they got busted.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: That wasn't Jack's fault.  No, that was on account of Buddy, for some reason, decided to call his sister and confess to a job <u>before</u> they'd done it instead of after.  She called the FBI and they both went down, ended up at Lompoc.  I think Buddy felt kinda bad about that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Any idea where I could find Buddy?  Or Glenn?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Ask him his name.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You're good.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: Adele?  You in there?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: I talk to the guy you work for, Emil. He tole me your number and where you live.  See, I'm looking for an assistant and would like to speak to you.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Oh.  Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: You did work for Emil, right?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Yeah, I was Emil's box-jumper for almost four years.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: You were his what, his box?

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: His assistant.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: You say you perform in the Miami area?

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: Yes, around here.  I was a mayishan in Cuba before I come here.  Manuel the Mayishan was my name.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I'm not dressed.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: Listen to me.  I'm a good friend of Jack Foley.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Wait in the hall!  I have to get dressed!

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: Tell me where is Jack Foley, I don't bother you no more.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: I don't know where he is.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: Listen, I'm the one help Jack escape from prison.  He tole me, I can't find him to see you.  So why don't you open this fucking door.  Okay?  So we can speak.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Go away, or I'll call the police.

turns.speaker: CHINO'S VOICE
turns.text: Why you want to do that, to a frien'?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It's Richard Ripley.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: The Wall Street guy?  Oh, yeah.  I didn't recognize him without his rug.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I bet that's all the hacks they send out.  Otherwise nobody's left to mind the store.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Why don't we talk about it later?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Where in the hell are we?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: That's the turnpike up there.  Glenn's waiting with the other car.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Okay, honey, come on out of there.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: We may as well leave her, we're leaving the car and we gotta leave her some place anyway, what's the difference where?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: She's coming with us.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, what were you doing in there?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Get the shotgun.  And her purse.  I'd like to know who she is.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Do we need him?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: The green-and-whites saw us.  One of 'em starts thinking, what's that car doing there?  Ties it to the break and turns around...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Let me have your raincoat.  Somebody forgot to bring me clean clothes.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I brought 'em, they're back at Glades in the Cadillac.  You wanted to take her car.
